conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the initial distance between the two cars.

The image shows a velocity-time graph with two lines labeled A and B. Line A starts at 25 m/s and decreases linearly to 0 m/s over 20 seconds. Line B starts at 15 m/s and decreases linearly to 0 m/s over 20 seconds.
Determine the initial distance between two cars based on their velocity-time graphs.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car A using the area under the velocity-time graph: 250 m.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car B using the area under the velocity-time graph: 150 m.
Determine the initial distance between the two cars by summing the distances: 400 m.
